name: Arborist

aliases.name: Context
aliases.comment:
View context. Contains the following fields:

  - `parent`: the item at the parent, not available for the root node
  - `siblings`: a list of all direct siblings
  - `children`: a list of all direct children
  - `state`: node [state](#NodeState)
aliases.type: { parent : Maybe.Maybe item , siblings : List item , children : List item , state : Arborist.NodeState }

aliases.name: NodeView
aliases.comment: View function for an individual node, depending on its [context](Context), and its value. This value is expressed as a maybe because the node may contain an `insert new node`-type placeholder.
aliases.type: Arborist.Context node -> Maybe.Maybe node -> Html.Html Arborist.Msg

aliases.name: StyledNodeView
aliases.type: Arborist.Context node -> Maybe.Maybe node -> Html.Styled.Html Arborist.Msg

types.name: Model
types.comment: Opaque type for the editor's model, dependent on a node type variable. You can only use this for type annotation - to initialize a new model, see [init](#init).

types.name: NodeState
types.comment:
The state of a node at a given time. May be normal one of the following:

  - `Normal`: node in rest state
  - `Hovered`: a hovered over node
  - `Active`: an activated node. Overrides hover
  - `DropTarget`: indicates that a swap or insert of the dragged subtree will take place at this node upon release

values.name: activeNode
values.comment:
Returns the current active node as a tuple of `Maybe node` (as the node maybe a placeholder for a new node), as well as some contextual information as a two-field record:

  - `position : ( Float, Float )`: the node's position on the canvas (useful for rendering an edit pop-up).
  - `context`: view context, identical to the one provided in [NodeView](#NodeView).
values.type: Arborist.Model node -> Maybe.Maybe ( Maybe.Maybe node , { position : ( Float, Float ), context : Arborist.Context node } )

values.name: applySettings
values.comment: Apply a new list of settings to the model.
values.type: List Internal.Settings.Setting -> Arborist.Model node -> Arborist.Model node

values.name: deactivate
values.comment: Remove active node

values.name: decoder
values.comment: Tree decoder as a function of the node's decoder. Assumes a `value` and `children` fields, holding the current node contents and an array of children, respectively.

values.name: deleteActiveNode
values.comment: Delete the active node from a tree, including all of its children. If a placeholder is active, this method does nothing.

values.name: empty
values.comment: Empty tree.

values.name: encoder
values.comment: Encodes a tree into JSON, given its node encoder.

values.name: flatten
values.comment: Flatten tree into a list of ( path, node ) tuples.
values.type: Tree.Tree node -> List ( List Int, node )

values.name: init
values.comment: Initialize model from a [tree](Tree).

values.name: initWith
values.comment: Initialize model from a [tree](Tree), using a list of [settings](Settings).
values.type: List Internal.Settings.Setting -> Tree.Tree node -> Arborist.Model node

values.name: node
values.comment:
Non-empty node, constructed from a single root node and an array of children represented as trees.

    node "Parent" [ node "Child1" [], node "Child2" [] ]

values.name: reposition
values.comment: Restores the original pan position of the tree.

values.name: resize
values.comment:
Resize the canvas by passing a new width and a new height. Note that you can reproduce this using [applySettings](#applySettings) as follows:

    resize 600 400 arborist == applySettings [ Settings.canvasWidth 600, Settings.canvasHeight 400 ] arborist
values.type: Int -> Int -> Arborist.Model node -> Arborist.Model node

values.name: setActiveNode
values.comment: Sets a new node at the active position. This may be adding a completely new node from scratch (in case the current node is a placeholder), or modifying an existing one. Typically, the modification is based off an original value provided by the [activeNodeWithContext](#activeNodeWithContext) method.

values.name: styledView
values.comment:
The editor's view function, taking the following arguments:

  - [NodeView](#NodeView): view function for an individual node.
  - a list of html attributes for the container element.
  - the editor's [model](#Model).
values.type: Arborist.StyledNodeView node -> List (Html.Styled.Attribute Arborist.Msg) -> Arborist.Model node -> Html.Styled.Html Arborist.Msg

values.name: subscriptions
values.comment: Subscriptions responsible for obtaining animation frames used to smoothly center an activated tree node. Using these subscriptions is completely optional - if they aren't wired up in your app, the editor will simply jump to the activated node without an animation. We recommend adding these subscriptions as you familiarize yourself with the package, as it is a significant user experience improvement.

values.name: tree
values.comment: Access the current state of the tree through this getter (returns structure defined in the `Arborist.Tree` module). The result reflects all changes since it was [initialized](#init).

values.name: update
values.comment: Update function handling changes in the model.

values.name: view
values.comment: Styled version of [view](#NodeView), using `elm-css`.
values.type: Arborist.NodeView node -> List (Html.Attribute Arborist.Msg) -> Arborist.Model node -> Html.Html Arborist.Msg

name: Arborist.Settings
comment:
Various settings for the editor, defined at the time of [initialization](Arborist#initWith), or [added](Arborist#applySettings) at any time later in the program. Includes various geometric settings such as canvas dimensions and the gutter between nodes, and, in a later version of this package, more functional settings such as hiding placeholder nodes.

@docs nodeWidth, nodeHeight, canvasWidth, canvasHeight, level, gutter, centerOffset, connectorStroke, connectorStrokeWidth, dragAndDrop, placeholderLeaves, throttleMouseMoves, sturdyMode

values.name: canvasHeight
values.comment: Sets the height of the canvas.

values.name: canvasWidth
values.comment: Sets the width of the canvas.

values.name: centerOffset
values.comment: When a node is activated, the interface centers it automatically. Sometimes, though, it is useful to move it somewhere other than the center, e.g. to accommodate a large pop-up underneath. With this configuration option, you can specify this offset, horizontal first, vertical second.

values.name: connectorStroke
values.comment: Stroke color of the lines connecting siblings.

values.name: connectorStrokeWidth
values.comment: Stroke width of the lines connecting siblings.

values.name: dragAndDrop
values.comment: Enable or disable drag and drop with this boolean flag (`True` is enabled, which is the default value). Note that the tree can still be panned if drag and drop is disabled.

values.name: gutter
values.comment: Horizontal gutter between nodes.

values.name: level
values.comment: Vertical distance between the bottom of a parent node and the top of its child.

values.name: nodeHeight
values.comment: Sets the width of node.

values.name: nodeWidth
values.comment: Sets the width of node.

values.name: placeholderLeaves
values.comment: Set whether placeholder leaves should be displayed.

values.name: sturdyMode
values.comment: Enables sturdy mode: as long as the tree is not empty, there is always one active node. Use this mode when it is critical that active node-related feedback doesn't leave the screen.

values.name: throttleMouseMoves
values.comment: Turn on mouse move throttling over a specified interval. You must connect `subscriptions` for this to work.
